comments:
This problem occurs in an IBM's tool based on Eclipse (ask me for detais).

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a new, empty workspace
2. Import Resources and StockQuote modules from StockQuote.zip PI file located in the directory of defect65276 on rolo2 (ask me for details)
3. In BI View, expand  Assembly Diagram and open it in the editor
4. In BI View, right-click StockQuoteService and select Refactor-->Rename...
5. Enter StockQuote-Service as the new name and click [OK] to finish refactoring


Defect Description:
There will be a warning-exception in Error Log:

org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Resource /Resources/StockQuoteService.wsdl does not exist.
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.checkExists(Resource.java:311)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.checkAccessible(Resource.java:187)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.getPersistentProperty(Resource.java:997)
	at com.ibm.[Removed by defect's oroginator - ask for details](Unknown source)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.LightweightDecoratorDefinition.decorate(LightweightDecoratorDefinition.java:253)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.LightweightDecoratorManager$LightweightRunnable.run(LightweightDecoratorManager.java:71)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:843)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.LightweightDecoratorManager.decorate(LightweightDecoratorManager.java:336)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.LightweightDecoratorManager.getDecorations(LightweightDecoratorManager.java:322)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.DecorationScheduler$1.ensureResultCached(DecorationScheduler.java:338)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.DecorationScheduler$1.run(DecorationScheduler.java:308)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

I'm not sure what your point is... From looking at the stack, someone is calling IResource#setPersistentProeprty, which states in the API: * @exception CoreException if this method fails. Reasons include: *
    *
  • This resource does not exist.
    • When a resource is deleted or renamed, the resource with the old name no longer exists, so this is working as expected. The caller should check for existence of the resource, or just catch and handle the exception without logging it (since it's a normal situation).

Do you know who could call it?
The BI view (like the Navigator View)? Or maybe the component that I commented out?

It's commented out:

org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.getPersistentProperty(Resource.java:997)
        at com.ibm.[Removed by defect's oroginator - ask for details]
